semantic_title: Status Post tPA Administration (Z92.82) - Transfer Facility Coding Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: Assign code Z92.82, Status post administration of tPA (rtPA) in a different facility within the last 24 hours prior to admission to current facility, as a secondary diagnosis when a patient is received by transfer into a facility and documentation indicates they were administered tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) within the last 24 hours prior to admission to the current facility. This guideline applies even if the patient is still receiving the tPA at the time they are received into the current facility. The appropriate code for the condition for which the tPA was administered (such as cerebrovascular disease or myocardial infarction) should be assigned first. Code Z92.82 is only applicable to the receiving facility record and not to the transferring facility record. (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75-L80)
content.summary: Z92.82 assigned as secondary diagnosis at receiving facility when patient received tPA within 24 hours at different facility, with primary condition coded first (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75-L80)
key_concepts: Transfer patient with tPA history (Evidence: pg no: 95, L76)
Secondary diagnosis usage (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75)
Different facility administration (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75)
Receiving facility only (Evidence: pg no: 95, L80)
Primary condition coded first (Evidence: pg no: 95, L79-L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use as secondary diagnosis for transfer patients who received tPA within 24 hours (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75-L76)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z92.82 should be assigned as secondary diagnosis when patient is transferred and received tPA within 24 hours at different facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75-L76)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Applies even if patient still receiving tPA at transfer (Evidence: pg no: 95, L78-L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: The guideline applies even when patient is still receiving tPA infusion at time of transfer to current facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L78-L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code primary condition first, then Z92.82 (Evidence: pg no: 95, L79-L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: The condition for which tPA was given (stroke, MI) should be coded first, followed by Z92.82 as secondary (Evidence: pg no: 95, L79-L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Only for receiving facility record, not transferring facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z92.82 should only be used in the receiving facility's record, not in the transferring facility's record (Evidence: pg no: 95, L80)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify patient as transfer from different facility
Step 2: Confirm tPA administration within last 24 hours
Step 3: Assign primary condition code first
Step 4: Assign Z92.82 as secondary diagnosis
Step 5: Ensure coding only at receiving facility

specific_codes.description: Status post administration of tPA (rtPA) in a different facility within the last 24 hours prior to admission to current facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75)
specific_codes.context: Secondary diagnosis for transfer patients who received tPA within 24 hours

coding_scenarios.scenario: Stroke patient transferred after tPA at outside hospital
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient transferred from outside ED where tPA was administered 2 hours ago for acute ischemic stroke. Patient continues to receive tPA infusion.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify acute ischemic stroke as primary condition
Step 2: Confirm tPA given within 24 hours at different facility
Step 3: Assign stroke code as principal diagnosis
Step 4: Assign Z92.82 as secondary diagnosis

correct_coding.rationale: Primary condition coded first, then tPA status for receiving facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L79-L80)

coding_scenarios.scenario: MI patient transferred 30 hours after tPA
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient transferred with STEMI. Received tPA 30 hours ago at referring facility.
step_by_step: Step 2: Do not assign Z92.82 due to timeframe
Step 3: Code only the MI condition

correct_coding.sequencing: MI only, no Z92.82 due to timeframe
correct_coding.rationale: Z92.82 only applies within 24 hours (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75, L78)

warnings: Only for receiving facility, not transferring facility (Evidence: pg no: 95, L80)
Must be within 24-hour timeframe (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75, L78)
Always secondary diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 95, L75)
best_practices: Verify exact timing of tPA administration
implementation_notes: Important for quality measures and outcomes tracking
